abstract: Bank of America, the largest U.S. bank, may cut branches over the next three years because customers increasingly rely on the Internet and mobile phones to manage their accounts, an executive told Bloomberg News.
snippet: Bank of America, the largest U.S. bank, may cut branches over the next three years because customers increasingly rely on the Internet and mobile phones to manage their accounts, an executive told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America may cut branches over the next three years because customers increasingly rely on the Internet and mobile phones to manage their accounts, an executive told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: BofA May Shift Branches to Web and Cellphones
